d:
On the Go is a bimonthly rideshare e-newsletter that contains user-friendly interactive flipping pages and resources links. It is sent out via an email link every other month (with a 1-page version for employees monthly). In addition, this publication is funded by 4 southern California transportation commissions and includes expanded sections for local county news.

We designed this 8-page newsletter to feature the latest rideshare news, program updates, advice, marketing ideas and more.

b: Client: Metrolink
d: HWDS designed and developed this interactive CD-ROM that includes an interactive iMag of the 20th Anniversary Report, an embedded video and links to external resource sites.

b: Client: LLG Engineers, Santa Ana, CA
d:
HWDS created this holiday E-card for Linscott, Law & Greenspan Engineers (LLG Partners). This Flash piece includes a dynamic starburst video and was distributed to clients of LLG Partners via e-mail to commemorate the New Year.
Click on the image to the right
to view a Flash animation.

b: Client: Southern California Regional Rail Authority, Los Angeles, CA
d:
HWDS created this holiday e-card for Metrolink. We created an illustration of the holiday train that includes flashing lights together with a holiday message and music. This Flash piece was distributed via e-mail to commemorate the 2010/2011 holiday season.
Click on the image to the right
to view a Flash animation.

b:
Client: Five County Transportation Commissions
—Metro, OCTA, RCTC, SANBAG and VCTC
d:
Each month, we design this informative online e-newsletter which is sent to employers to promote commute options for employees. This online publication includes a teaser page that is distributed via e-mail and links back to a Web site. This publication is funded by a consortium of five county transportation commissions and is designed to be user-friendly and to provide inspiring ideas for developing effective rideshare promotions. Please visit the Web site at http://www.commutesmart.info/
csnews/index.html

b: Client: National Preservation Partners/City of Los Angeles
d: Our firm was hired by the Office of Los Angeles City Councilmember Jos√© Huizar to create a new Web site and Vision Document to promote a revitalization of the Broadway Theater District in Downtown LA. We combined art deco elements and typefaces to create a unique identity for this historic revitalization that brought together community and business leaders. The entire Web site can be viewed at: www.bringingbackbroadway.com

b: Client: Tashman and Associates, Santa Monica, CA
d: We designed a new Web site for Tashman and Associates, a merchandising consultant for retail giants such as Home Depot. We designed this site to include a scrollable search engine, audio tracks, special rollover effects and an introductory Flash presentation that builds the logo. This Web site is a companion piece to a 6-color fold-out brochure that can be viewed in the publications section of our Web site. Please visit www.tashman.com

b: Client: Pathways Strategic Communications, Los Angeles, CA
d: HWDS designs and maintains the Web site for this non-profit organization that promotes the writings of female authors and includes an annual literary event to benefit a local children's charity. Please visit www.womenandwords.com

b: Client: Los Angeles Metropolitan Transportation Authority (Metro), Los Angeles, CA
d: HWDS has designed e-blasts for the Los Angeles Metropolitan Transportation Authority (Metro) to promote events such as Bike to Work Day, Rideshare Week as well as special commuter incentives for vanpooling, carpooling and public transit usage. These e-blasts are distributed via e-mail to more than 1,500 Southern California employers and link back to Web pages that include sound clips and the full articles.

b: Client: Torrance Historical Society, Torrance, CA
d: HWDS designed this Web site using archival photos to promote local historical society. HWDS used colorized historical photos and arranged these in a clickable grid which links to web pages on museum events, opportunities and charitable donations. Please visit the Web site at http://www.torrancehistoricalsociety.org/

b: Client: Legal Firm, Santa Ana, CA
d: HWDS created the initial design for this law firm Web site. We also created the Flash animation for the top of the main interface.

b: Client: Southern California Regional Rail Authority (SCRRA)
d: HWDS regularly designs new Web banners for special events, construction and maintenance updates, new equipment and schedule changes.

b: Client: Cherriots Rideshare, Salem, OR
d: HWDS was commissioned to design an interactive Web site, a new logo identity and a marketing package to promote ridesharing and commute alternatives for the Salem-Keizer Transit District in Salem, Oregon. The goal was to emphasize that ridesharing can improve one's quality of life by reducing stress, traffic congestion, air pollution and a reliance on gasoline. We created a unique curved layout of rollovers for the main home page and gave the site a branded look consistent with the program's logo identity. Please visit www.cherriotsrideshare.org.
